page.title: 08HOUSING IN CROUGHTON 3
page.content: There are a large number of American families living in rented houses in the village, usually in small older properties or on the Portway Estate. The constant need for housing for servicemen has created a market in the area for houses for well paid tenants whose conduct can be assured by the USAF authorities. This need has been exploited by those who purchase such houses as become vacant, modernise them and offer them for let. The most direct result of such action is the shortage of older houses for purchase by first time buyers. Another disadvantage is that of having a large group of villagers whose social life is focused on the base.
